text.p: Glynwed International Plc said on Tuesday that 1996 results were affected by metal price pressures and weaknesses in continental European markets, but it is cautiously optimistic about this year.
Pretax profit at the industrial holding company before exceptionals came in at 93.7 million stg from 84.9 million previously.
After an exceptional charge of 16.2 million for losses on the sale of businesses, pretax profit slipped to 70.1 million from 84.2.

"On the positive side, demand from consumer durables is strengthening, there are signs of improvement in the housing market and metal prices have shown some recovery," chairman Gareth Davies said in a statement.
However, he noted that the strength of sterling if maintained will have a significant impact on the UK economy and said that many markets in continental Europe remain subdued.
It plans to pay an unchanged total dividend for the year of 12.75p per share.
Shares in the company had fallen 5-1/2p to stand at 299p by 0933 GMT.
